tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE fitness_classes (
    class_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    class_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    class_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    instructor_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    class_schedule TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    participants_count INT
)

CREATE TABLE ClassParticipation (
    participation_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    class_id INT NOT NULL,
    member_id INT NOT NULL,
    participation_date DATE NOT NULL,
    duration_min INT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (class_id) REFERENCES GroupFitnessClasses(class_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (member_id) REFERENCES MemberData(member_id)
);

CREATE TABLE class_details (
    class_id INT,
    class_name VARCHAR(50),
    class_instructor VARCHAR(50),
    class_duration INT,
    class_location VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE member_details (
    member_id INT,
    member_name VARCHAR(50),
    member_email VARCHAR(50),
    member_phone VARCHAR(20),
    member_join_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE class_schedule (
    schedule_id INT,
    class_id INT,
    schedule_day VARCHAR(10),
    schedule_time TIME,
    schedule_duration INT
);

CREATE TABLE classes (
  class_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  class_name VARCHAR,
  class_type VARCHAR,
  instructor_id INT,
  class_schedule TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE members (
  member_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  member_name VARCHAR,
  member_age INT,
  member_email VARCHAR,
  member_address VARCHAR
)

CREATE TABLE registrations (
  registration_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  class_id INT,
  member_id INT,
  registration_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE instructors (
  instructor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  instructor_name VARCHAR,
  instructor_email VARCHAR,
  instructor_phone VARCHAR
)

CREATE TABLE attendance (
  attendance_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  class_id INT,
  member_id INT,
  attendance_date DATE
)
